# # HELP SCREEN #
HOW TO SCORE TO ENTER A SCORE JUST
TAP THE BUTTONS OR GAME. ↓↓↓ SCROLL DOWN FOR MORE ↓↓↓ TIPS DARTSCAPE GAME MENU LEGS AND SETS
TAP ONCE FOR A SINGLE
DOUBLE TAP FOR A DOUBLE
PRESS AND HOLD FOR A TRIPLE
TRY IT BELOW!
TAP THE BUTTON NEAR THE TOP OF THE SCREEN TO JUMP TO DIFFERENT SECTIONS OF THIS HELP SCREEN. ADD NEW PLAYERS AND CHANGE PLAYERS NAMES BY CLICKING THE "PLAYERS" BUTTON IN THE BOTTOM LEFT OF THE GAME MENU SCREEN. PRESS THE BACK ARROW ← AT THE TOP LEFT OF THE SCREEN TO RETURN TO THE PREVIOUS SCREEN OR BACK TO THE GAME. AN ONGOING GAME OR MATCH WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY SAVED WHEN THE APP IS CLOSED SO YOU CAN RETURN TO IT LATER. TO SEE A PLAYER'S INDIVIDUAL STATS IN THE STAT SCREEN, CLICK ON THE PLAYER'S NAME. COMPARE STATS WITH THE BUTTON ABOVE THE PLAYERS LIST.

DARTSCAPE SETTINGS
THIS SCREEN
IN THE GAME OF DARTS, A "LEG" IS A SINGLE GAME IN A "MATCH". IN A "LEG RACE" THERE IS A SET NUMBER OF LEGS A PLAYER MUST WIN IN ORDER TO TO WIN THE MATCH. FOR EXAMPLE, IN A LEG RACE TO 5 LEGS, THE FIRST PLAYER TO WIN 5 LEGS (5 GAMES) WINS THE MATCH.
A "SET" IS A NUMBER OF LEGS. TO WIN A SET A PLAYER MUST WIN THE BEST OF THE SET NUMBER OF LEGS. FOR EXAMPLE, IF THE NUMBER OF LEGS IN A SET IS 5, THE FIRST PLAYER TO WIN 3 LEGS WINS THE SET. THIS IS THE SAME FOR MULTIPLE SETS. IF THERE ARE 3 SETS IN A MATCH, THE FIRST PLAYER TO WIN 2 SETS WINS THE MATCH.
THE OBJECT SCORING VARIANTS
THE GAME PLAY STARTS WITH A SCORE OF 301, 501, 701, 901, ETC… THE OBJECT IS TO GET YOUR SCORE TO EXACTLY ZERO BY THROWING ROUNDS OF THREE DARTS AND SUBTRACTING THE SUM OF THOSE THROWS FROM YOUR CURRENT SCORE. TO START SCORING THE PLAYER MUST MEET THE GAME "IN" VARIANT REQUIREMENT (SEE BELOW). ALL NUMBERS ARE IN PLAY INCLUDING BULLSEYE. THE PLAYER CAN HIT A SINGLE, DOUBLE OR TRIPLE OF ANY NUMBER. THE NUMBER IS THEN MULTIPLIED AND SUBTRACTED FROM THEIR SCORE. TO WIN, THE PLAYER'S SCORE MUST REACH EXACTLY ZERO AND MEET THE GAME "OUT" VARIANT REQUIREMENT (SEE BELOW). IF THE PLAYER'S SCORE GOES BELOW ZERO, THE PLAYER'S TURN ENDS AND THEIR SCORE RETURNS TO WHAT IT WAS AT THE BEGINNING OF THEIR TURN. THIS IS CALLED A BUST. A GOOD STRATEGY IS TO AIM FOR THE HIGHEST SCORING NUMBER (TRIPLE 20) UNTIL THE PLAYER IS IN SCORING RANGE TO WIN. STARTING SCORES
301, 501, 701, 901,
1001, 1201, 1301, 1501

STRAIGHT IN\OUT
ANY NUMBER CAN BE HIT.

DOUBLE IN\OUT
ONLY DOUBLES CAN BE HIT

TRIPLE IN\OUT
ONLY TRIPLES CAN BE HIT.

MASTER IN\OUT
DOUBLES, TRIPLES OR BULLSEYES
CAN BE HIT.
THE OBJECT OF CRICKET IS TO HAVE THE HIGHEST SCORE AND "CLOSE OUT\” NUMBERS 15 THROUGH 20 AND THE BULLSEYE. TO SCORE, THE PLAYER MUST HIT ANY OF THE ACTIVE NUMBERS (15 THROUGH 20 OR THE BULLSEYE). THE PLAYER CAN HIT A SINGLE, DOUBLE OR TRIPLE OF ANY NUMBER. WHEN THE PLAYER HITS A NUMBER THEY GET A MARK ON THAT NUMBER REPRESENTED BY A SLASH " / " ON THE SCORE SHEET. WHEN A PLAYER GETS THEIR THIRD MARK ON A NUMBER, THEY "CLOSE" IT. THIS IS REPRESENTED BY A CIRCLE "〇" ON THE SCORE SHEET. ONCE A PLAYER CLOSES A NUMBER THEY CAN BEGIN TO START SCORING ON THAT NUMBER. FOR EXAMPLE, IF A PLAYER HITS A TRIPLE 20 AND A DOUBLE 20, THEY WOULD CLOSES THE NUMBER AND SCORE ON THE DOUBLE 20 (40 POINTS). WHEN ALL PLAYERS CLOSE A NUMBER THE NUMBER BECOMES INACTIVE. INACTIVE NUMBERS CAN NO LONGER BE HIT TO SCORE. CUT-THROAT
IN THE CUT-THROAT VARIATION OF CRICKET THE OBJECT IS TO HAVE THE LEAST SCORE AND CLOSE ALL NUMBERS (15 – 20 AND THE BULLSEYE). WHEN A PLAYER SCORES ON A NUMBER, ALL OTHER PLAYERS WHO DO NOT HAVE THAT NUMBER CLOSED WILL ACCUMULATE THE SCORE. IF ANOTHER PLAYER HAS ALREADY CLOSED THAT NUMBER, THEIR SCORE IS UNAFFECTED.

SCORE CAP
A SCORE CAP CAN BE ADDED TO THE GAME TO PREVENT PLAYERS FROM ACCUMULATING VERY HIGH SCORES, FORCING THEM TO MOVE ON TO OTHER NUMBERS. PLAYERS CAN ONLY SCORE UP TO THE SCORE CAP PLUS THE LOWEST SCORING PLAYER'S SCORE. FOR EXAMPLE, IF THE SCORE CAP IS SET TO 100 AND PLAYER 1 HAS A SCORE OF 134, AND PLAYER 2 HAS A SCORE OF 19, PLAYER 1 CAN ONLY SCORE UP TO 119 POINT BEFORE HE MUST MOVE ON.

OPEN/TURN SCORING
OPEN SCORING MODE LETS PLAYERS KEEP SCORE WITHOUT HITTING "NEXT TURN". THE DOWNSIDE TO THIS IS THAT STATS WILL NOT BE TRACKED.
THE OBJECT OF SHANGHAI IS HIT A SHANGHAI OR TO HAVE THE HIGHEST SCORE AT THE END OF THE GAME. TO SCORE THE PLAYER MUST HIT THE ACTIVE NUMBER. THE ACTIVE NUMBER CHANGES EACH ROUND, COUNTING UP OR DOWN. THE PLAYER CAN HIT A SINGLE, DOUBLE OR TRIPLE OF THAT NUMBER. THAT NUMBER IS THEN MULTIPLIED AND ADDED TO THEIR SCORE. IF THE PLAYER HITS A SHANGHAI THEN THEY INSTANTLY WIN THE GAME. A SHANGHAI IS WHEN A PLAYER HITS A SINGLE, DOUBLE AND TRIPLE OF THE ACTIVE NUMBER IN THE SAME ROUND. WHEN THE LAST NUMBER IS FINISHED THE GAME ENDS AND THE PLAYER WITH THE HIGHEST SCORE WINS. IF THERE IS A TIE, THE PLAYER WITH THE MOST TRIPLES WINS. IF THEIR TRIPLES ARE TIED, THE PLAYER WITH THE MOST DOUBLES WINS. IF THESE ARE TIED, THE PLAYER WHO THREW FIRST IN ORDER WINS. STARTING NUMBER
THE NUMBER THE GAME WILL BEGIN AT.

ENDING NUMBER
THE NUMBER THE GAME WILL END AT. IF THE ENDING NUMBER IS LOWER THAN THE STARTING NUMBER THE GAME NUMBERS WILL COUNT DOWN INSTEAD OF UP.
THE OBJECT OF BASEBALL IS TO HAVE THE MOST RUNS AT THE END OF THE GAME. IN BASEBALL THERE ARE A NUMBER OF INNINGS, WHICH ARE LIKE ROUNDS. EACH INNING, THE PLAYER MUST THROW AT THE NUMBER WHICH CORRESPONDS TO THE INNING. FOR INSTANCE, DURING THE 1ST INNING, THE PLAYERS THROW AT THE 1, 2ND INNING, THE 2, AND SO ON. A PLAYER CAN SCORE ON A SINGLE, DOUBLE OR TRIPLE OF THAT NUMBER. THE PLAYER CAN ALSO SCORE ON THE SINGLE BULLSEYE (THE GREEN AREA OF THE BULLSEYE). IF A PLAYER SCORES A SINGLE, IT IS LIKE A SINGLE IN BASEBALL, ALL RUNNERS ON BASE ADVANCE 1 BASE AND THEY GET A RUNNER ON 1ST BASE. THE SAME GOES FOR DOUBLES AND TRIPLE. THE SINGLE BULLSEYE COUNTS AS A HOME RUN, WHERE ALL RUNNERS ADVANCE TO THE HOME PLATE. WHEN A RUNNER ADVANCES THE THE HOME PLATE, THE PLAYER GETS A RUN, REPRESENTED BY THEIR SCORE. IF A PLAYER DOES NOT HIT ANY PART OF THE ACTIVE NUMBER, OR THEY HIT THE DOUBLE BULLSEYE (THE RED AREA OF THE BULLSEYE), THE THROW IS COUNTED AS AN OUT. AFTER THE PLAYER GETS 3 OUTS, THEIR TURN IS OVER AND THE NEXT PLAYER BEGINS. AFTER THE LAST TURN OF THE LAST INNING, THE PLAYER WITH THE MOST RUNS WINS. IF THERE IS A TIE, THE GAME CONTINUES TO THE NEXT INNINGS UNTIL THERE IS A WINNER. INNINGS
THE NUMBER OF INNINGS IN A GAME.

CHALLENGE
TO MAKE THE GAME MORE CHALLENGING MAKE A DOUBLE = A SINGLE, A TRIPLE = A DOUBLE, A SINGLE BULLSEYE = A TRIPLE, AND A DOUBLE BULLSEYE = HOME RUN.
THE OBJECT OF KILLER IS TO ELIMINATE ALL OTHER PLAYERS BY KILLING ALL THEIR LIVES. THE GAME BEGINS WITH EACH PLAYER THROWING WITH THEIR NON-DOMINANT HAND. WHATEVER NUMBER THEY HIT BECOMES THEIR NUMBER FOR THE DURATION OF THE GAME. TO BEGIN KILLING OTHER PLAYERS, THE PLAYER MUST FIRST HIT THE DOUBLE OF THEIR OWN NUMBER. WHEN THIS HAPPENS THE PLAYER THEN BECOMES A KILLER (BY TAPPING THEIR "KILLER" BUTTON). NOW THE PLAYER CAN BEGIN AIMING AT AND HITTING THE DOUBLES OF OTHER PLAYER'S NUMBERS. WHEN A PLAYER IS A KILLER AND HITS A DOUBLE OF ANOTHER PLAYER'S NUMBER, THE PLAYER WITH THE HIT NUMBER LOSES ONE LIFE (BY THE KILLER TAPPING THE OTHER PLAYERS "KILL" BUTTON. NOTE: MAKE SURE THE CORRECT "KILLER" BUTTON IS SELECTED TO KEEPS STATS CORRECT). WHEN A PLAYER RUNS OUT OF LIVES THEY ARE ELIMINATED. THE LAST PLAYER TO NOT BE ELIMINATED WINS. KILLERS
THIS IS THE NORMAL GAME VARIANT WHERE MULTIPLE PLAYERS CAN BECOME KILLERS.

ONE KILLER
IN THIS GAME VARIANT ONLY ONE PLAYER CAN BE THE KILLER AT A TIME. WHEN ANOTHER PLAYER HITS THIER NUMBER, THEY BECOME THE KILLER AND THE PREVIOUS KILLER LOSES THEIR KILLER STATUS.

OTHER VARIANTS
IF HITTING DOUBLES SEEMS HARD, IT CAN BE CHANGED TO HITTING OTHER PARTS OF THE NUMBER LIKE THE INNER OR OUTER SECTION OF THE SINGLE, OR THE TRIPLE.
